title: AI in Robotics and Future Trends
description: Explore the evolution of AI in robotics, key technologies, real-world applications, and hands-on object detection and gesture recognition.
learning_objectives: Understand the evolution from traditional robots to AI-enabled robots.
Explore key AI technologies in robotics.
Examine real-world applications and future trends.
Practice real-time programming for object detection.
Experiment with real-time hand gesture identification.

task_steps.title: Open VS Code
task_steps.instructions: Open VS Code on your system and create a new workspace.

task_steps.title: Open GitHub
task_steps.instructions: Open this link in your browser.

task_steps.title: Download Code
task_steps.instructions: Click on the **Download raw file** button on GitHub to save the file.

task_steps.title: Open File in VS Code
task_steps.description: Access the downloaded code in VS Code.
task_steps.instructions: Go to **File → Open File** in VS Code and select the Python file.

task_steps.title: Check Model
task_steps.instructions: Ensure the correct AI model is downloaded and linked to the program.

task_steps.title: Connect Mobile to System
task_steps.instructions: Use a USB cable to connect your mobile phone to the system.

task_steps.title: Run Object Detection Program
task_steps.instructions: Open a dedicated terminal in VS Code and run the Python file.

task_steps.title: Object Detection
task_steps.instructions: Use your mobile camera to detect real-world objects in front of it.

task_steps.title: Hand Gesture Program
task_steps.instructions: Repeat the same process with the hand gesture program.

concepts.title: 1. Evolution
concepts.summary: From Traditional Robots to AI-enabled Robots
concepts.learn_more_context: Explain how traditional robots differ from AI-enabled robots in terms of adaptability, perception, and decision-making.

concepts.title: 2. Core AI Components
concepts.summary: Controllers, AI Software Architecture, Machine Learning, Computer Vision
concepts.learn_more_context: List and briefly describe the four main Controllers, AI software architecture, Machine Learning, AI components in robotics, highlighting their individual functions

concepts.title: 3. Computer Vision & Perception in Robotics
concepts.summary: How robots see and interpret their world.
concepts.learn_more_context: Discuss how computer vision helps robots understand their environment. Give some examples of perception in real-world industrial robotics

concepts.title: 4. Natural Language Processing (NLP) for Human–Robot Integration
concepts.summary: Enabling speech and text interaction with robots.
concepts.learn_more_context: Explain how NLP enables human–robot communication. Provide one use case where NLP is essential in robotics

concepts.title: 5. Autonomous Systems & Navigation
concepts.summary: Path planning and autonomy for safe robot movement.
concepts.learn_more_context: Describe how autonomy and navigation work in AI-enabled robots. What technologies support safe path planning?

concepts.title: 6. Industry Applications & Future Trends
concepts.learn_more_context: Identify two industries using AI robotics and describe one future trend that could shape their applications

quiz.title: Knowledge Check: AI in Robotics
quiz.description: Test your understanding of AI technologies and applications in robotics.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the shift from traditional robots to AI-enabled robots?
options: Ability to perform repetitive tasks only
Incorporation of perception, learning, and decision-making
questions.explanation: AI-enabled robots incorporate perception, learning, and decision-making abilities.

questions.question: Which core AI component enables robots to interpret sensory data and recognize objects?
questions.explanation: Computer vision interprets visual and sensory data for object recognition.

questions.question: What is the primary role of a controller in an AI robotic system?
options: Managing hardware operations and executing AI algorithms
questions.explanation: Controllers bridge hardware and AI algorithms, ensuring correct execution.

questions.question: Natural Language Processing (NLP) in robotics is mainly used for:
questions.explanation: NLP enables robots to communicate with humans via speech and text.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of an autonomous robotic system?
questions.explanation: A bin picking robot makes decisions based on perception, classifying it as autonomous.

questions.question: Machine Learning in robotics allows robots to:
options: Repeat tasks exactly as programmed without change
Improve performance based on data and experience
Reduce the number of sensors required
questions.explanation: Machine learning enables robots to learn from data and enhance performance.

questions.question: Which AI technology is most critical for enabling robots to navigate dynamic environments safely?
questions.explanation: Computer vision and perception guide robots in obstacle detection and safe movement.

questions.question: In healthcare, AI-enabled robots are being used for:
questions.explanation: AI-enabled robots assist in surgeries and monitor patients in hospitals.

questions.question: What is a major future trend in AI robotics across industries?
options: Increased autonomy and adaptability in unstructured environments
questions.explanation: Future AI robots will adapt better to dynamic and unstructured environments.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a key AI component in robotics?
questions.explanation: Drivers are not considered a core AI component in robotics.
